title: Scenic Walk
text: Beautiful views of the city....what a great spot. Bring a picnic lunch or dinner or just stretch your legs and enjoy!

title: Pizza, salad and the Brooklyn Promenade!
text: We wanted to expand our horizons and explore some of Brooklyn’s neighborhoods. Brooklyn Heights is gorgeous....I feel like I have watched many movies filmed there. Dellarocco’s is in the heart of it all-great service, great food, great location. I went with two teenagers and they loved it too!

title: Amazing tour!
text: I have always been very interested in this community. Frieda was born into the Hasidic community. Her tour have great information and interesting insights into this Place and people. We stopped into some authentic businesses for some local fare and treats throughout the tour. I loved it!
place: Hasidic Williamsburg Walking Tour in New York City

title: Authentic Jewish food in the heart of Hasidic Williamsburg
text: We stopped here during our tour with Frieda. Got to sample a lot of different foods....would go back. Not Peter Luger's, but that is not my cup of tea anyway!

title: What a view
text: Beautiful views of the NYC skyline and Statue of Liberty. Restaurants, food trucks, volleyball, bocci, picnic areas and walking paths. I just left and want to go back!

title: Just perfect
text: Got off the beaten path and headed to Brooklyn instead of Manhattan. We took a tour with Tours by Frieda and booked a room at Pointe Plaza which is in the heart of the Williamsburg Hasidic community. This hotel reminds me of a small European hotel. Not fancy, but clean and friendly and close to all we needed. We walked all through Williamsburg and Domino Park, with its beautiful views of the NYC skyline and statue of liberty, is about a mile walk away. Be respectful, have an open mind and dress conservatively while visiting this neighborhood.

title: Awesome
text: Great, centrally located. We had one night in Athens for sightseeing. This hotel provided an idea spot for laundry breakfast and burgers. There is always a daily walking tour that leaves @ 10:00 a, lead by an Australian. Luggage can be left if you have down time before your flight.

title: What a view!
text: After sightseeing all day we headed up here to see the beautiful view! So beautiful, not to be missed!!

title: Quaint and beautiful
text: After sightseeing all day, we strolled through Plaka to shop for souvenirs and enjoy dessert and coffee under the illuminated Acropolis.

title: Somebody pinch me!
text: After learning about the Greeks in school, it was awe-inspiring to see the acropolis in person. The United States is so young compared to Greece.

title: Breathtaking
text: After studying about the Greeks and Roman years ago in school, it was the trip of a lifetime to see these things for myself!

title: Do not bypass!
text: We saw so much in just one day. Going to the museum really helped to explain everything and put it into context!

title: We got the most out of our one day in Athens!
text:
Frank picked us up at the airport and in no time we were on our way! We had a full-day private tour of Athens with Frank and our English-speaking guide Sophia. We told them what we wanted to see and they did not disappoint!
Frank even made a restaurant recommendation and brought us back to the airport the next day. Although pricier than the on and off bus, I highly recommend seeing Athens with HP Tours, especially if you only have a limited amount of time. I can honestly say we got our money's worth!

title: Delicious!
text: After long days of exploring and sightseeing, our group wanted something quick and easy! One night we did pizza, and calzones another. Delicious and good value!

title: Delicious, quick and cheap!
text: My teenagers were getting a little "hangry" as we waited for the bus back to our hotel. The chicken pitas were less than 3 euro each. Delicious!

title: Just Lovely!
text: My family and I enjoyed drinks and salads here while we swam and sunbathed at Kamari Beach. Heavenly!

title: Absolutely perfect!
text: My sister and I and my four teenage children recently visited Santorini. Hotel Matina was the perfect base for our holiday. The daily breakfast was delicious. Everyone who works at this family owned and operated establishment treated us like family and did all they could to make our stay perfect and it was. The bus stop to Oia and Fira is just outside the front door. The beach is just a 2-3 minute walk. The pool was beautiful and relaxing. The pool bar serves sandwiches/salads, etc. The staff helped us arrange tours and recommended restaurants. The world is big and there are many places I would still like to see, but I do hope to return to Hotel Matina one day!

title: Great food, good vibe
text: My daughter and I had lunch here. The build your own burger options are great and salads are terrific. The staff could not have been nicer.

title: Great late night pizza, coffee
text: We like to go here at the end of our evening visits to PTOWN. My teens love their pizza. I like the coffee.

title: THIS is Cape Cod
text: Amazing beach. You will see seals. There are restrooms, showers and changing facilities. Bring your own food. The vistas are breathtaking!

title: High energy fun!
text: Commercial Street has such a great energy. Whether you are young or old, single or coupled, gay or straight, there is something for everyone from honkey tonk to high end, ice cream to 5 Star dining.

title: Beautiful!
text: Enjoy the breathtaking scenery, shop for trinkets or fine art, go on a whale watch or learn about pirates. This is a cool place. Public restrooms, parking lot, bus service

title: Cool Building
text: Long time Cape Codder, but this summer I first stepped inside. It is a very cool old building. We saw a show there, nice acoustics, clean modern restrooms.

title: Great spot in the middle of it all
text: It is hard to keep everyone happy, so your best bet is to stop into the nut house. Whether they want candy, ice cream, coffee or pastry.....the Nut House has it all! Owner operated

title: American Airlines is AOK
text: We got good rates and everything was on time and satisfactory. I will fly on American again. Kids wanted TVs, so we will bring a phone or tablet with pre down loaded movies next time

title: Great road trip
text: So great to see all of the memerobilia and highlights. Lots of cool exhibits. I’m so glad we finally made the trip!!!

title: Great family meal.
text: In a city like Toronto where there are so many options, Wayne Gretzky’s was a great choice for us-burgers, salads and lots of cool souvenirs to see!

title: BEAUTIFUL
text: I went with my 4 children. we spent one day in the park and took a four hour horse/mule tour that left from Bryce Lodge. Make reservations in advance.

title: Checking things off my USA bucket list
text: We hiked the Narrows. Our grouped ranged in ages from 12 to 46. Kids are all athletic. You can go as fast/slow as you want/need. Rent the equipment! worth the extra money!

title: amazing
text: Once in a lifetime experience. we saw all of the highlights of Bryce! If you are concerned about the money, it was worth every penny!!

title: Great spot
text: We stayed at Ruby's Campground in our rented RV, but spent time at Ruby's Inn at the gift shops, grocery store, etc. Very cool spot. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Shuttle for Bryce leaves from the front of Ruby's.
